BoutrosLab.plotting.survival 3.0.10
  • Reference

    Utility function to make Kaplan-Meier plots

    make.survfit.plot.Rd

    A utility function that makes half of each Kaplan-Meier survival curve. It needs to be called twice, once for patients who had an event and once for the overall curve.

    Usage

    make.survfit.plot(x, xlimits, xat, type = 1, main = NULL, main.cex = 3.0,
    line.colours = c("blue", "red"), enable.warnings = FALSE,...);

    Arguments

    x

    An object of class survfit

    xlimits

    A two component vector listing the upper and lower bounds of the x-axis (time dimension)

    xat

    A vector listing the points at which x-axis labels should be drawn

    type

    If type = 1, draws the step curve. If type = 2, draws the censored points

    main

    The main title for the plot (space is reclaimed if NULL)

    main.cex

    Size of text for main plot title

    line.colours

    A vector of colours to be used in plotting

    enable.warnings

    Print warnings if set to TRUE, defaults to FALSE

    ...

    Any additional parameters to be passed to xyplot

    Details

    This function is rarely called directly, but instead is used in larger plotting functions.

    Value

    Takes a survfit object and returns a lattice object containing part of a Kaplan-Meier curve. For most practical cases this needs to be called twice, once with type = 1 and once with type = 2.

    Author

    Paul C. Boutros

    See also

    xyplot, lattice for an overview of the package.

    Examples

    # create some synthetic survival data
survstat <- sample(c(0,1), 100, TRUE);
survtime <- runif(100) * 100 / 12;
survobj  <- Surv(survtime, survstat);
groups   <- sample(c(0,1), 100, TRUE);

# set the graphics driver
current.type <- getOption("bitmapType");
options(bitmapType = "cairo");

# open output file
tiff(
  filename = "Test Plot.tiff",
  height = 7,
  width = 7,
  units = "in",
  res = 100,
  compression = "lzw"
  );

# plot the step curve
plot(
  x = make.survfit.plot(
    x = survfit(survobj ~ groups),
    xlimits = c(0,9),
    xat = seq(0,9,3),
    type = 1,
    main = 'Test Plot',
    enable.warnings = TRUE
    ),
  position = c(0.03,0.2,1.0,1.0),
  newpage = TRUE
  );

# without creating a new plot, add the censored points
plot(
  x = make.survfit.plot(
    x = survfit(survobj ~ groups),
    xlimits = c(0,9),
    xat = seq(0,9,3),
    type = 2,
    main = 'Test Plot',
    enable.warnings = TRUE
    ),
  position = c(0.03,0.2,1.0,1.0),
  newpage = FALSE
  );

# finish plot
dev.off();
#> Warning: No TIFF support in this version of R
#> agg_png 
#>       2 
options(bitmapType = current.type);
